text: - I'm Ari Morcos.
I'm the CEO and co-founder of DatologyAI.
So, how does GenAI impact what we do?

Well, we are built from the
ground up for the GenAI era

to help companies who wanna
train their own models

on their own data,
their most unique asset,

to identify what is the right
data to train their models on

so that they can get
models that train faster,
get better performance, and are smaller.

So, what's the biggest
misconception about GenAI?
I think right now

there's a lot of attention
being focused on language models
because they're incredibly exciting.
But language is really just the beginning
and the tools that underlie GenAI,
the ability to train on massive data sets
that are unlabeled,
are applicable to every type of data.
And I think over the next five years,
we're gonna see this percolating
to every aspect of the economy,
well beyond just language.

So, how should we balance
safety and deployment
when we think about GenAI models?

Well, ultimately, GenAI
models are what they eat.

The data you show them
determines everything
about the results and performance.

If you show them biased
data, they'll be biased.

If you show them unsafe
data, they'll be unsafe.
But if you show them data

that's representative of
the population, that's safe,
you'll have models that are for everybody,
not just for a select few.
So ultimately, like all things in AI,
this comes down to a data problem.

And the way we can make sure
that we're deploying models
that are effective and safe for everybody

is by making sure we train
them on the right data.
How does AWS help us at Datology?
Well, a key part of what we do at Datology
is training models in order to make sure

that we are providing
the best quality data
for model training.

And that's something
that we do on SageMaker,
using HyperPod and other AWS services

that make it really easy for
us to scale our trainings

to large numbers of GPUs
quickly and effectively.
AWS helps DatologyAI be more innovative.

At DatologyAI, we're performing
cutting-edge research

in order to help everybody
train their models
more effectively through better data.
In order to do that,
we need to be able to train models
on massive data sets at scale,

and that's something
that would be impossible
without the help of AWS.
(light upbeat music)
